title: Kavelj22
author: Kavelj22
content: At the current period in which the crypto market is experiencing a recovery in daily trading volume and asset prices, news have been circulating for days the news of Binance launching an application for conversations called “Binance Messenger.” [1][2][3] According to what these sites published, the application is a messaging tool that enables its users to enjoy all their favorite options, as on other well-known messaging applications. These articles did not mention any peculiarities that could distinguish this application from others, given that it is one of the pioneers in the field of web3, and the company responsible for developing the application is the famous company Cyberconnect, whose token value has increased by a good percentage since the news of the application’s launch was announced, declaring that Binance is one of its most satisfied customers.The application was launched on the appstore in a first stage and is scheduled to be launched on Android soon.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: With the so many messenger apps available such as Telegram, Discord, WhatsApp, Facebook Messenger. I don't see the point of the app. Maybe an inbuilt troll box within the Binance App could be OK. This reminds me of the time Binance launched a “decentralized exchange” just because the likes of Etherdelta, Forkdelta were so popular, but it was all a complete fail. I don't think that messenger app will gain any traction in my opinion.

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: I honestly think it would be the most useless app. I can imagine that with their telegram group which seems to be abandoned without an active moderator. There it's mostly just pump and dump conversations by some spammers.
